review.reviewBody: My son got this and is really pleased with it. He said the fabric is soft and light weight. Plans on wearing it while hitting trails on his dirt bike. Thanks for a great product!

comment: Thank you for your review of our Daily Tube! We pride ourselves on the quality of product we deliver and it's always nice to hear people are loving their BlackStrap gear!

review.reviewBody: Made in the USA. I am one that tries to support American made products as much as possible.
review.name: Happy Customer

review.reviewBody:
Great product and super happy to buy made in USA! 
If we were all willing to pay a little more for quality products more Americans would be working right now!
review.name: Old glory sun mask

review.reviewBody:
Love love love that’s it’s made in USA and that company HQ is in Bend Oregon, my home town!

Keep up the great work guys you have a lifelong customer with me
review.name: Best USA Made tube mask!!

review.reviewBody: This mask is very soft as other BlackStrap products. And design is also very nice! I love it!
review.name: Comfortable, Good look!

review.reviewBody: Stylish and comfortable. I put it on in the morning and just forget about it. Not hot but also gives you a wind barrier
review.name: Daily mask

review.reviewBody: Love the purple color. It fits well even though I have a small, almost child size, head. Great for protection from wind. I wear it as a mask and for sun & wind protection when fishing and hiking. Fabric is non irritating to my sensitive skin. It washes well.
review.name: Great first tube

review.reviewBody: The tube is made really well however, it’s to large and does not stay up over my face. I am an average size female adult so I’m not sure how this tube works for others. The cardboard “Packaging” the tube came on was rather large and I am wondering if it got stretched out.
review.name: Too large
comment: Thanks for your feedback on our Daily Tube! Our tubes are sized to fit most adults with a relaxed fit, you can check the back of our packaging for varying examples of wearing applications which can help the Daily Tube fit more snugly.

review.reviewBody: I love this product because it represents a special cause for me. I am a Bristol Bay Salmon fisherman. So I will proudly wear it at the frontlines. The quality is great. Works well every day in the age of covid 19. I recommend the purchase for those interested
review.name: Save Bristol Bay-No Pebble Mine sun mask

name: Daily Tube

review.itemreviewed: Zodiac Plus GTX Backpacking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody:
Pros:
Durable
Great ankle support
Good grip on scree
Waterproof

Cons:
Heavier than other options
Narrow fit - if you don't have narrow feet or you wear thick socks these will probably be unpleasant
review.name: Narrow fit but awesome boot

review.itemreviewed: Zodiac Plus GTX Backpacking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I absolutely loved these boots but after less than 3 months of use I had to warranty them because the Vibram sole was cracking. I reached out to Backcountry and was told that Scarpa wants all warranty issues to go directly through them. I reached out to Scarpa and got an ra# and was told to mail the boots in. I did as instructed and after 2 weeks I hadn’t heard anything even though the tracking information showed that the boots had been delivered. I reached out to Scarpa again and was told that they had received my package and that they has sent new boots out to me already. The issue is they stated that the new pair had been delivered a week before I reached out to check on the status of my warranty. Before I reached out was no notification that they had received my boots and no notification that they had sent anything out to replace them. As a result I had no idea that a package was on the way and no tracking information. For boots this expensive I would have expected that they would keep me updated on the status of my warranty. Instead I received no information and had bo idea that anything was on the way. At this point my boots are missing (presumably stolen off of my front porch). When I attempted to express concern that no information was provided until after the package was allegedly delivered I was told that their warranty team was very small and that they don’t have the time to provide updates. I’m now in a position where I’ll have to replace these boots due to Scarpa’s sloppy handling of the warranty process and I will not be considering Scarpa products again any time soon.
review.name: Incredible Boot with Awful Service

review.itemreviewed: Zodiac Plus GTX Backpacking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody:
Just wore these out of the box and they were great. I have a regular foot, maybe a little bit of a high instep. I wear a 9 in street shoes and 9.5 in athletic shoes, the 41 fit great with a regular hiking sock, single layer. It was pretty cold this morning and my feet were warm. A little breaking in will make for a perfect boot. I have had many Scarpa tele boots and they have always fit and performed great.

I would give 5 stars except Backcountry really blew the fulfillment. Instead of the boots I received 2 muffler plugs for a 2 stroke engine. Wonder how that happened? I do not own and never have owned anything with a 2 stroke engine. I also wonder who got the first pair of boots.  I call customer service, which went fine. I requested an expedited delivery, they said  -- sure, how about overnight. Sure, I said back. More than a week later I finally got my boots. Step it up Backcountry!!
review.name: Great boot/Poor fulfillment

review.itemreviewed: Zodiac Plus GTX Backpacking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I brought these boots for a hiking trip in the White Mts NH.  After the 5th day of wearing the boots the rubber on the toe box started to peel.   For the price of the boots, the craftsmanship of the toe box was very poor.
review.name: Backpacking Boots

review.itemreviewed: Zodiac Plus GTX Backpacking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody:
Although they are still in great shape after nearly 2 years of 3 season use, I'm ordering a second pair for when they wear out. These lightweight but supportive hiking boots are perfect for hard to fit feet like mine: sensitive ankles, narrow heels, high arches and wide toes. I'm usually 38 2/3 in a hiking boot but needed a 39 for width/arch room, especially with my orthotics. 

They are waterproof and comfortable in temperatures 30-80 F. For winter in Maine, I need winter hiking boots with more insulation and better snow traction.
review.name: Fav 3 season boot but order 1/2 size up

review.itemreviewed: Zodiac Plus GTX Backpacking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: A decently stiff boot which is an upgrade from my La Sportiva's which were getting a little soft for me. Good support, roomier toe box. Slight heel lift, need to switch out the insoles for my custom ones and I think they'll be pretty damn good boots for a few seasons of hiking and hunting. Got a 41, I'm typically a 9.5.
review.name: Initial Impressions

review.itemreviewed: Zodiac Plus GTX Backpacking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I just purchased my second pair of Zodiac Plus GTX by Scarpa.  I hike and backpack the majority of the time in the Sierra Nevada range.  It's rocky and tough on your feet, especially when carrying 35 pds.  I've also used them for day hikes in the San Gorgonio wilderness area.  Again, rocky!  I've had extensive surgery on my feet, reconstructive and pinned together.  My feet are always the first thing to slow me down and cause me trouble during long days or long weeks.  I've spent YEARS searching for trail shoes and boots to help me stay in the mountains longer with less pain.  This boot works!  A semi rigid boot gives me the protection I need against the rocky terrain.  These are still a fairly lightweight boot also!  I was surprised how much flex I did have with them scrambling to summits.  I get the support I need with a heavy pack for backpacking, yet they are useful on very rocky summits even when dayhiking and don't feel heavy.  They are not insulated.  I can use them late into fall in Southern California but I do switch to an insulated boot for winter mountaineering.  I would call this a 3-season light mountaineering boot.  Great in alpine but in warmer weather.  I have never had wet feet and I plow through water and light snow with them.  They fit like a glove.  I'm a women's size 10 with average to narrow feet.  The 41.5 fits me in this boot the best, even though that translates to a size 9.5.  Due to the amount of time I'm in the mountains I need to replace boots regularly.  These lasted over two years for me!  That's a record!
review.name: Great boots!

review.itemreviewed: Zodiac Plus GTX Backpacking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: No break in required foe these boots. Wore them out of the box on a 7 mile hike with a 3500 altitude incline to break them in. Have also completed 14ers in these boots. Best for more technical hikes - rocks, boulders, skree, etc. I've worn them on lesser hikes, but they are probably more boot than I needed for that. Either way, incredibly comfortable! I have a high instep and lots of shoes hurt my arch or the top of my foot. These boots did not - they were amazing from the first moment I put them on, until the end of  long days hiking. I wear a size 9 hiking boot and took a size 40 in these boots. Might be narrow for wider feet. I would definitely recommend.
review.name: Amazing boots!

name: Zodiac Plus GTX Backpacking Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody: This is the best alpine climbing pack available that I know of. It’s very durable. Very light. Totally waterproof. Climbs great. Carries great. Looks great. 10/10. I use this year round.
review.name: Absolutely Waterproof Alpine Pack

review.reviewBody: Best pack Mountain hardware has ever made, I use this for mountain rescue missions and recently took this into some canyons in Zion and fully submerged this pack in pools of water for extended periods of time and it stayed completely dry. My only complaint is they don’t make this in a 55L size!!
review.name: Insane water proofing

review.reviewBody: So far I'm really enjoying this pack. Enough room to use it as a travel bag, detachable brain comes off easily and you can fit the main body of the bag in an overhead on the plane. Remove the frame too, and you have a great roomy daypack. The lightweight and durable materials held up against some solid rain while hiking in the cascades with no water seeping through. Looking forward to putting it through some more technical adventures this summer! Giving 4 stars because I'd have liked an interior sleeve along the back to help separate avalanche tools or do other minor internal organization in the main compartment, but otherwise this is almost exactly what I've been looking for!
review.name: High quality, versatile backpack

name: Alpine Light Roll Top 45L Backpack

hasVariant.description: Buy the Fjallraven Expedition Pack Down Hooded Jacket - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.itemreviewed: Expedition Pack Down Hooded Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody:
I bought this recently after outgrowing a jacket I used for many years! I keep my jackets for multiple years and am very pleased with it so far. It’s extremely cozy and warm and I get cold easily! 

I live in the interior of BC, Canada, where it’s often brisk in the mornings and evenings. I am 5’6” and 170lbs of muscle with wider hips and shoulders - this jacket in a large fits perfectly with room for a hoodie underneath while not being too tight on my bum. The forest green colour is also beautiful and matches my green eyes but that’s besides the point.

I love it and hope it lasts many many years!
review.name: Cozy and perfect!

review.itemreviewed: Expedition Pack Down Hooded Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody:
I wanted to leave a review for other petite mid-size women as it is hard for me to find jackets that fit without being drowned in sleeves. 

I’m 5’1” 155 lbs measurements 40-36.5-41.5 (between US sizes 10-12)

I ordered a large because I wanted it roomy enough for a sweater inside but not so big I look like a potato sack. The Large met this need, I can wear it with just a base layer, when I hike in the winter and add a sweater if it’s too cold. The sleeves because of the cuffed ends worked well for my short arms (usually large jackets the sleeves go past my arm or balloon so much in the cuff, this one didn’t). My gloves did not get “pushed out” by the sleeves

Overall great down jacket for a petite mid size woman, worth the price
review.name: Jacket for a petite mid size woman

review.itemreviewed: Expedition Pack Down Hooded Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody:
I’ve had this coat for a few weeks now and I love it. It’s dreamily warm, looks fantastic and the pack down feature it really going to be great for travel. It has even performed perfectly on walks in temperatures well below freezing. 
I’m just over 5’6” and 150 lbs, athletic build and medium works well. It was slightly larger than what I thought it would be, as I am hoping to use it under a waterproof layer soon, but the small would likely have been too small. Still thinking it will work as a mid layer when I need it to.
review.name: Love this coat!

review.itemreviewed: Expedition Pack Down Hooded Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: Bought this for my wife for Xmas, and she has worn it every day since! Even in California. She loves it.
review.name: Comfy and stylish

review.itemreviewed: Expedition Pack Down Hooded Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: I bought this to go under my Keb rain shell, to turn the Keb into a proper winter coat. It works great! I'm now comfortable in wet blustery winter weather. And on days when it's cold but dry, this down jacket is great by itself. A total winner! Couldn't be happier.
review.name: Love it.

review.itemreviewed: Expedition Pack Down Hooded Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: Super warm. The hoodie is great and the front flap keeps your chin and lips out of harms way if zipped all the way. You can easily lower it, to your liking, to control warmth. I love this jacket, and it is now my goto for really cold days.
review.name: Warmest i have ever worn

review.itemreviewed: Expedition Pack Down Hooded Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: This is a great jacket, but I find the same problem as with North Face and Canada Goose:  The Medium fits perfectly in arm length, body length, waist and hips.  But I have a larger chest (DD) and it is too snug, just through the chest.  The jacket is clearly made for a smaller chested figure.  Going up to the size LG is not an option, it is too big every where else. It would be so simple to put an elastic gusset in the side seams just in the chest area to accommodate a larger chest. Please consider this!  Otherwise the jacket is wonderful.
review.name: Great jacket, warm & lightweight - too small in chest, needs side gusset in chest area

review.itemreviewed: Expedition Pack Down Hooded Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: This is the second one of these that I have purchased. First one in black and second in the dark green. The warmest jacket I have ever owned. One for best and one for work. Never felt cold during the nightshift working outdoors. My mum, dad and brother have also all purchased this coat (different colours of course) and have all stated how warm they are.
review.name: Perfect winter coat

review.itemreviewed: Expedition Pack Down Hooded Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: I love this jacket. I have tried a lot of down jackets for hiking and lightweight warmth - this one meets all of my needs! I can't believe how warm it is even in a Minnesota winter. I can wear this one down to about 15 F comfortably.
review.name: Warm for how compact it is!

review.itemreviewed: Expedition Pack Down Hooded Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: I love this jacket so much!!  I love the vibrant blue color, the warmth, the way it fits, the light weight, the zippered pockets, the large hood, the ease of laundering----everything about it!!!   I wear it for hiking, walks in my neighborhood, and riding my horse.  It's warm and cozy on cold, windy, rainy days.   I'm 5'1" and 105 pounds and the XS is a perfect fit even with a couple of layers underneath.  It's just a beautiful comfortable jacket.
review.name: LOVE

name: Expedition Pack Down Hooded Jacket - Women's

hasVariant.name: Manaslu 8000 Mountaineering Boot - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Asolo Manaslu 8000 Mountaineering Boot - Men's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I wanted to love these boots. They fit well, the features are great, they're fairly light for a triple boot, etc. 

I bought them for an Aconcagua climb, and the zipper on the integrated gaiter blew within 2 miles of wearing them on both boots. I was able to reset the zipper on the left boot (it blew again) and was unable to reset the zipper on the right boot. I am not sure if I have a faulty pair, or if it is a design flaw that puts too much stress behind the zippers, but ultimately both failed within 2 miles of wearing them and I was unable to get them back to a normal functioning state. Which is super disappointing for a pair of $1,500 boots. 

Another thing I'd like to note is the foam soles. The sole of this boot is made of foam, not rubber. The only part of the sole that is rubber is at the toe. Despite only having 3 miles on them the sole is noticeably worn from moving through scree. This might be fine if you plan to have crampons on the entire time you wear them, but if you plan to use them without crampons be aware they will not last very long. 

I'd look at something else. The La Sportiva Mons Cubes have a wrap around zipper design which might help to relieve the stress on the zipper.
review.name: Integrated gaiter failed after 2 miles.

name: Manaslu 8000 Mountaineering Boot - Men's

review.reviewBody:
As others have noted, what a strange fit!  Not just the usual Castelli skinny Euro road racer fit, but just a poorly designed fit. Otherwise this would be a fantastic shoulder season and winter jacket down to the mid 30's with a good base layer. The materials and the finish are top notch, and as a bonus the roadie look of contrasting panels is thankfully missing. But what else is missing is a normal fit for cycling. The arms are a bit long which is fine, better than too short and they are trim, not arm warmer tight, but trim, with room for a ls base layer and good mobility .
The shoulders for my normal build- ie. I?m not a broad chested swimmer or weight lifter, are also sized accurately. Around the waist is also sized with a slight bit of room, again trim but not summer race jersey fit. But the chest ? the chest fit is designed for someone with a 44-46 chest. The extra volume is ridiculous. I?m 5?11, 182 winter weight with a 40.5 chest and line up perfectly with Castelli's XL . With the Go jacket, wearing a 200 wt. merino base layer and on the hoods, there is easily 4.5? of fabric gapping at the chest in an XL. Even with Castelli's usual Euro racer sizing this is just weird. It?s a shame because otherwise this would be a winner. I really wonder who the lead designer at Castelli uses for sizing.
review.name: It?s all about the fit.

review.reviewBody: I was looking for a nice Gore-Tex jacket shell without any fleece or other warming material.  I like to build my own layers and thought this was the answer.  Not sure what Castelli is doing with this jacket.  After trying it on, I can say I have never had a Castelli jersey or jacket fit this loose around the midsection.  It also runs longer in the front than I would like.  I'm not looking for an aero fit, just a more fitted cut (such as Gore's C5 offerings).  This is more like a club fit.   I guess if you carry a little extra around the mid-section, this might do the trick for you.  Castelli certainly identified the market opportunity for this type of jacket, but ventured into new sizing that is very un-Castelli like. Didn't work for me so I had to return it.
review.name: Not what I expected

review.reviewBody: I wear a medium in most brands, and typically wear race fit items. I am 6ft, and 165lbs with a 40 inch chest. I ordered a large in this item based on their size chart, and figured this would still be tight based on most Castelli sizing. I was wanting something slightly more relaxed for layering for maximum versatility. This fit like an actual American sized large, and was way too big. I understand that this isn't race fit cut, but I could probably wear a small in this item.
review.name: Castelli sizing is all over the place.

name: Go Jacket - Men's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Crank Brothers Candy 3 Pedals online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
...the more you use it. If you come from SPDs, it'll take you a few rides to get used to the different clip-in engagement feel. It's been covered elsewhere: while SPDs engagement is typically positive and followed by a loud "click" sound, the CB system is more vague --I equate it to the feeling I get when I cut through butter; it's still satisfying and recognizable, but its different.

Other than that, the Candy 3's are lighweight, give me sufficient platform paired with Specialized 2FO shoes with really sticky rubber. The pedals themselves seemed a bit stiff right out of the box but I have a hunch that is simply a break in aspect.

I'll try to update this as I get more rides --though, knowing me, I'll probably forget unless I run into trouble.
review.name: Clip in engagement gets better...

review.reviewBody: I have been using SPD pedals for years and I wanted to add a small platform for my gravel bike. I have been easily able to get in and out of even the cheapest SPD's but these pedals are very difficult to find the sweet spot. You have to find just the right spot and them push you foot forward to get in. They do feel supportive once you are in. And it is nice to be able to use your SPD shoes. I would not recommend them to anyone doing any riding where you are frequently clipping in and out.
review.name: Have to say no, not 'in' to them.
comment: Witch pedals you would recommend then ?

name: Candy 3 Pedals

hasVariant.name: Raptor 14L Hydration Backpack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Osprey Packs Raptor 14L Hydration Backpack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This was a gift for my nephew. I’ve owned my Raptor 14 pack for 5 years of heavy use. Simply put, it’s my top goto pack. The bite valve wears out over time, but is easily remedied with a Osprey replacement valve. I love this pack because it’s big enough to haul ample of water for long rides and carry warm clothing for when the sun drops and you have a long (and cold) descent back home.
review.name: This was a gift for

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I recently tried the raptor 14 update. This pack has some very cool new features that set it apart from the older edition. The hydration bag connection to the pack itself has a slip and lock feature that makes the hanger secure, and the tube and bite valve are ported through a zipper sleeve to the user. A continuous stretch pocket runs along the exterior of the pack that allows for small and large gear to be tightened down with a cinch down pull strap. A roll out tool bag that can also be handy for first aid. This bag is definitely the brain child of an active user.
review.name: I recently tried the raptor

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I’m very happy with the Raptor 14. I’ve used several different backpacks before, but none have felt as secure and lightweight, even when carrying a lot of gear.
review.name: I’m very happy with the

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love the pack, very comfortable even when riding my bike. One thing I would like is for it to be a bit more space (maybe 18L or 20L). Otherwise, very nice pack.
review.name: Love the pack, very comfortable

review.reviewBody: Love the way it fits, I primarily use this as a day hiking bag just because I prefer the fit on the shoulders as a tall woman. There are plenty of good storage options. The one issue is the hydration tube is too short and pokes me a bit in the neck and if I bend over / squat down to look at stuff, it pops off the magnet. Especially if I have it packed rather full. Also when the bladder is full it sits a bit pear shaped and I get pretty sweaty at the low back
review.name: Fits nicely, good compartments, tube too short

review.reviewBody: I bought this when I rode my bike from Vancouver (Canada) to Seattle over a weekend. While I did have a 5L frame bag I was stuck between a handle bar bag, seat bag or a small backpack for the extra supplies I needed to bring. While I finally decided on this because I might be able to use it for more than just biking, the price tag and thought of wearing a backpack for hours was giving my buyers remorse before I even got home… I took out the hydration bladder to fit everything more snug to my back and also tried to keep it light with clothes, cash, cards, passport, first-aid, and bike tools, I did have to load it up with extra hydration bottles on the outside so it still had a bit of weight (maybe 4 or 5 kg) - I didn't really notice it for the back to back 130km rides! It far exceeded my expectations for comfort and ability to adapt to what I needed to pack. This is a great addition on top of the other bicycle bags for your bike tours or if you want a really comfortable, well made, in-between small and medium backpack. Such a good bag I even wrote a review! Do wish it came with a rain cover though for the price *
review.name: Buyers remorse

review.reviewBody: I use it every time I go mountain biking. I will never take a trip without it. Just bought one for my wife too. It's comical that the other review says the drink tube is too short...it's not lol. The person probably had the tube setup wrong. I don't know what they expect, a garden hose to drink from? All in all its the best mtb pack I've ever had the pleasure of using.
review.name: Best mtb pack I've ever used.

review.reviewBody: The bag itself is great. The drinking tube is disappointingly short for anybody over 180cm and a bit of a chest, and apparently it's not possible to order a longer one. Also a bit of a miss, the excess of the straps can't be tied up, so they flap around when at speed or when there's wind.
review.name: Good backpack but the drinking tube is disappointingly short

name: Raptor 14L Hydration Backpack

hasVariant.name: Velo Cache 2 Bike Storage Column
hasVariant.description: Buy the Feedback Sports Velo Cache 2 Bike Storage Column online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
This bike rack was a perfect solution for us to store two bikes in our space-challenged carport. Our bikes are also more available, more protected from the elements, and more secure all at the same time.

Backcountry.com delivered a highly commendable, Amazon-like experience on product availability, pricing, and free 2-day shipping. I look forward to buying from them again.

Following are some details that may help others should they decide to buy one of these.

The assembly directions are perfect, but too cute and too small to get the hints of detail most need to get assembly right the first time.

There are three main mounting bolts. One is smaller than the other two. This is not obvious. I grabbed the small one by accident to start the assembly. 

If your mounting bolts are going in too hard, you probably are putting them in the wrong end of the column. There are identifiable threads for the bolts in the column where you attach the base. There are no threads in the other end, but the bolts still will go in--with much effort. I am lucky I didn't damage the bolt heads such that I couldn't back them out and put them in right.

Once I got it assembled, I marveled at the quality and genius of the thing.  We store two street bikes on it with no fear of it tipping over, even with the heaviest one on top.

A trick we learned was to have our bikes point in opposite directions. Because of the angles of the bikes' top tubes, the front wheel of the bike on top slips behind the back wheel of the bike on the bottom, allowing the top bike to be stored a good 18" lower. This makes it much easier to take the top bike down and put back.
review.name: Tough assembly. Worth the effort.

name: Velo Cache 2 Bike Storage Column

review.reviewBody: I have been wearing Uggs faithfully for the past 15 years-both their regular boots and their winter boots. I bought these boots in black last season (colour appears to not be available anymore), and am so profoundly disappointed with these boots that this purchase will, without a doubt, be the last time I ever purchase an Ugg product. In addition to the laughably cheap quality of these boots, Ugg as a brand is also very questionably marketing these boots as "weather ready". I live in a semi-arid desert-type of climate that does not get very much snow nor rain, but it does get cold. My feet were not only freezing because of the complete lack of insulation, but also because of the downright terrible "waterproof features". In the face of ANY light rain or snow, my feet (including my soles!) would get soaked within 15-20 minutes of wearing them outdoors-even by stepping in puddles after a storm. As a result, multiple pairs of my socks have been horribly stained black from the boots. I genuinely do not know what type of weather Ugg is claiming these boots are "ready" for, as they could not even hold up in what is effectively a desert climate. Do not waste your money on these, they are literally the functional equivalent of fashionable running shoes. Buyer beware.
review.name: DO NOT BUY THESE THEY ARE ANYTHING BUT WEATHER READY!!

review.reviewBody: These boots are so freaking sick, I bought the brown ones and the black ones! They feel great too.
review.name: Good quality

review.reviewBody: First glance these boots are lovely. They are very stylish and will work well in the cold. These boots fit true to size but the style is very narrow. I would not recommend if you have a wide foot or larger ankle. The sole is very thick and the grip looks really good for walking in snow will try these out and report back.
review.name: Stylish but Narrow

review.reviewBody: Love Love these boots. They are very warm inside. I brought my daughter and I both a pair.
review.name: Very nice boots

review.reviewBody: The Style Of The Boots Are Neat I Brought Them For Work Could Not Keep Them On All Day Too Narrow
review.name: No

review.reviewBody: I bought these boots for the snow season and found that they offer little warmth to the whole foot. The ankle has ample fur lining which is nice but the sole of the foot is a smooth material that is rather cold.
review.name: Very little warmth

review.reviewBody: I am a little disappointed with the boots. One, not very comfortable at least for my feet. Two, snow or rain and my feet are freezing. The insulation of these boots not good at all. The snow or water touches the front your feet and they are cold. They are not thick enough. They are good to keep your feet dry but not good enough for keeping them warm. I wear two pairs of socks to keep my feet warm. At that I have wool socks on. They are very nice boots but only for looks and style. I am on a hunt new boots that will keep my feet warm and not have to wear two pairs of socks. If you want them for looks definitely get them but for outdoors not durable.
review.name: No

review.reviewBody: I'm not using the product I would like to return it
review.name: No I want to return it

review.reviewBody: I just got these boots and I love the style sooo much. However, they are very narrow. Also, I went half a size up to make sure they are wide enough for my wide small feet. Hence, now they are too big in length and very narrow in width. Please tell me will these stretch over time? As I'm absolutely in love with the style.
review.name: So tight

review.reviewBody: I would not recommend this shoe it looks great in person but fits narrow and the toe frame is very restricting. I received these as a Christmas gift in my usual size 8.5 and was disappointed when they did not fit right. I decided to go an entire size up to a 9.5 because I really wanted them to be comfortable and still no luck. Now I can't exchange them again so save your money and order the Adirondack's that fit true to size or find a new brand altogether!
review.name: Very narrow and restricting

name: Ashton Addie Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody:
I discovered Nani just recently and was obsessed with this Chesapeake Bay print, and I'm so glad Backcountry had them in stock!
I've never tried this style top before, so I was worried about the sizing. The size chart said I could either do a Medium or Large (36 band, 42 bust). I decided to size down, thinking eventually the top would stretch out with wear. I'm glad I went with the medium,  its snug and supportive without being too tight or constricting. The reversible fabric/print, and scoop/v-neck is amazing! This is going to create so many fun combinations!
review.name: Chesapeake Bay Print is Everything!

review.reviewBody: I'm still looking for a good brimmed helmet to replace an old Salomon model and this didn't cut it. I tried it on and top sit high, much higher then any other helmet I've tried. Kind of look like a horse riding helmet, if you are into that. My hat size is 7.25, so I order the Large and it was really snug.
review.name: Horse riding?

review.reviewBody:
This helmet is the base model for Sandbox Classic 2.0, so there isn't a clicker dial to tighten the inner liner, which is actually a plus for me. I find those clickers eventually wear out and break. The sizing pads provided should suit most people, the material is very high quality and warm. This helmet has no MIPS tech but is EU Alpine certified and made with an extremely durable injection mold plastic. For most people this product is gonna go above and beyond safety wise compared to a Walmart helmet. 


 I was a little nervous when I initially purchased this due to lack of accurate reviews online regarding fit with goggles, but when I put my Smith Squads on it made a seamless fit with the helmets brim/vent holes. I attached a picture to show how well this helmet fits with the Smith goggle profile. 


Overall a high quality product that I will hopefully wear for years to come.
review.name: Very comfortable helmet!

review.reviewBody: Definitely not audio compatible like the technical specs describe. Zero pockets in the ear flaps. Returned it.
review.name: Not audio compatible

name: Classic 2.0 Snow Original Fit Helmet

review.reviewBody: Both the cut and the material used to make this Castelli Race Day polo are very nice, so much better than the thin, shapeless polos available in nearly every color imaginable from the non-cycling brand with a crocodile logo. The red placket is a stylish touch. The only minor knock is that it has one too many logos given that Castelli is already spelled out across the back. A little bit more understated, please; I am not riding my bike in this polo. Order the same size as your Castelli cycling jersey, instead of your regular American T-shirt size, and it will fit you very well.
review.name: Nice, Soft, Fitted Polo

review.reviewBody:
Ordered these shirts for a work function and found that they were off by a size for everyone. I normally wear a M and I had to size up to a L. Everyone else had to do the same. 

Once it’s on, the fit is nice and the quality seems pretty good too.
review.name: Nice Shirt, Sizing Off

review.reviewBody: Being a smaller leaner guy this fits perfect yes XS fits me like a glove I'm 5 foot 5, 126 to 127lbs race weight hence they call it race day polo these are made for pro cyclist build not that im  a pro but it fits. not made for the average american male sorry guys
review.name: EXCELLENT!

name: Race Day Polo Shirt - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Point N Chute Sensor Glove - Men's
review.reviewBody: Haven't had a chance to use these on the slopes yet but they seem warm and well-made. Just what I needed.
review.name: Perfect

review.itemreviewed: Point N Chute Sensor Glove - Men's
review.reviewBody: Not very durable. I only used it occasionally but the strap has been torn.
review.name: Not very durable

review.itemreviewed: Point N Chute Sensor Glove - Men's
review.reviewBody: These seem like decent gloves, they kept my hands mostly dry in warm conditions sledding and skiing all day. I was a disappointed to find that the pinky finger is too short when otherwise the fit is good. Never experienced that before. I have a different, lighter pair of OR gloves in size large (to accommodate liner layer options) and they are a bit lose on their own so I thought I'd go for a medium in these ones. Unfortunately didn't work out. I'm hoping they stretch out a bit - otherwise I'll be selling a replacing with something different. I'm also not impressed by the design. The palm side is basically all exposed seams on the fingers, which I didn't see in the photos online. I don't think they'll hold up very long, but you get what you pay for. Next time I'll be going for something built to last.
review.name: Dry hands but a cramped pinky finger

review.itemreviewed: Point N Chute Sensor Glove - Men's
review.reviewBody: Love this glove. Skied it quite a few times and my initial impression is great. There is alot of insulation on the inside of the hand and I'm not a huge fan of that. However, it may break in. I'm overall great glove.
review.name: Solid Glove Little Clunky

review.itemreviewed: Point N Chute Sensor Glove - Men's
review.reviewBody: Waterproof and warm. Used these last weekend in ~0 F temps and they held up well. Dexterity is a little limited as they are bulky, but significantly better than that of a mitt. These are an expensive purchase but the durability along with OR's top notch customer service/warranty ensure that these will last a long long time.
review.name: Excellent Ski Gloves

review.itemreviewed: Point N Chute Sensor Glove - Men's
review.reviewBody: I bought these gloves as a gift for my son. When he puts them on he uses the little pull loop to pull them onto his hands. However, the pull loop is attached to the quarter inch top hem, which means that when stress is applied to the loop, it pulls on the quarter inch hem instead of pulling on the glove sections. So now the top hem as well as the pull loop are separated from the glove and the hem is torn. Considering the price of the gloves, I would have thought that more concern would have gone into the stresses of pulling the gloves on. Other than this particular flaw, my son really likes the gloves.
review.name: Possible product design defect

review.itemreviewed: Point N Chute Sensor Glove - Men's
review.reviewBody: I know it's generally true that gloves really aren't suited for keeping your hands warm. If you need warm hands-use mitts! That said, these gloves are very warm, and manage to be reasonable dexterous at the same time. I got these just before a week-long -40 deg C cold snap, and they were wonderful to have. While I still couldn't reach into my coat pockets to grab my keys, they managed to keep my fingers warm the rest of the time. The leather is very nice and they're super comfortable. My hands are at the top end of "medium" and the mediums fit great. They're also very easy to slip on and off if you leave the cuffs loose, which is handy. A final nice point: the wrist straps are removable, so if you're using them for daily stuff like I have been, you can untie them, and save them for later. Overall, very happy.
review.name: Very Warm

review.itemreviewed: Point N Chute Sensor Glove - Men's
review.reviewBody: The top glove I've owned so far, warm and good range of motion. Perfect for skiing in below freezing conditions
review.name: Very impressed

review.itemreviewed: Point N Chute Sensor Glove - Men's
review.reviewBody: I bought these and had the first pair rip on the inside before I took them to the hill. Got them replaced quickly and so far they seem fantastic! I can't comment on durability yet but the gloves keep me warm and dry and fit me perfectly (online measurements were accurate for me), they seem like they're going to break in really well.
review.name: Pretty Good!

review.itemreviewed: Point N Chute Sensor Glove - Men's
review.reviewBody: I haven't put it through a full winter season yet, but thus far it has been a Great glove and Extremely warm.
review.name: Nice glove.

name: Point N Chute Sensor Glove - Men's

review.reviewBody: I have worn these on a couple of rides. They are most comfortable and solid shoes imaginable. I have not heat molded them yet nor do I think it will be necessary. The blue/purple color looks fantastic. They keep my feet plenty warm in the winter. Will they be too hot in the summer? Time will tell but I ride in the early morning anyway. I'm completely satisfied with my purchase.
review.name: Solid and comfortable

review.reviewBody:
The GOOD: toe box is roomy, BOA dials are top quality and adjust in both directions, can mount cleats far enough rearward to accommodate my long toes.
The BAD: can't form carbon around bony prominences. Most shoes your foot sits ON TOP of carbon fiber sole. These Lakes, as well as Bonts, your foot rests INSIDE a "dish" of carbon fiber. From the ball of your foot back around your heel, the carbon fiber is going half way up your foot, unlike most shoes that have leather, fabric or Lorica that adapts and forms to your lumps, bumps, vessels and nerves. These have rock solid carbon fiber encasing your foot, and unless your foot is close to the ideal foot shape that Lake engineers are imagining they aren'tgoingto work for you either. I followed instructions explicitly for 3 moldings and can't get it to form to my foot. There are several warnings provided with shoes regarding overheating and over stressing the carbon that I am afraid to crack/break it. Have ridden these on trainer 3X and now and have bruises where rear BOA dial is. If you expect to be able to mold these like an Intuition ski boot liner, you can't, not even close. If you try to form these with a vacuum or without your foot in them ,you will damage them and void any warranties. SUCH AN UNCOMFORTABLE SHOE.
Also, since it's been 45 days since purchase, BACKCOUNTRY is strictly enforcing their no exchange policy, so I'm stuck with them. If you get these, put them through the wringer within 30 days or you will be stuck too. I would recommend, as with ski boots, to get them at your local shop that actually provides customer service. BACKCOUNTRY had a decent price, but with zero customer service and no way to get these to work for my feet, I now have $350 paperweights. I really wanted these to work, and thought they would based on reviews, but its not even close. Good luck, hope this helps you.
review.name: MASSIVELY DISAPPOINTED

review.reviewBody: First off, these shoes run 1/2 to a full size smaller than the 402 model it replaces and possibly narrower.  I have middle of the road medium 43.5 size feet but had to size up to 44 for the 403s and I possibly should have sized up to 44.5 or got the wide version based on the following. There is a point where the outside of my foot touches where the carbon sole gets thick leading to the arch.  This is comfortable when cycling but if I walk in these shoes there is painful carbon on bone contact. Example, walking or standing around for 5 to 10 minutes prior to the ride is painful. Since the carbon is so thick in that area, there is no way to heat mold the sole to fit better. To be fair, I have the same issue with the 402 generation although it is a little less noticeable because that generation sizing runs larger.  Note, I also have the Assos variant of the 402s which do not have the sole issue at all in the standard 43.5 size.
review.name: These shoes run small

review.reviewBody: When I first got the shoes , it took three times to mold them and get it really right. Now it’s really the only shoe I ride on. I have really nice high-end shoes from other brands. None of them feel like the lake product to me and the company is really easy to deal with, if you have any questions or you need to trade sizes, no questions were ask.
review.name: 403’s

review.reviewBody: Perfect.  That's how I'd rate these shoes.  After trying many different brands, at many different price points, I've found the most comfortable shoe on the market.  I've probably used these shoes for 800+ miles, and can't find anything wrong with them. in other shoes, I'd inevitably find hot spots or other aches on long rides, but not these.  Out of the box, they fit my narrow feet without the need to heat mold them; and with each ride they have become more comfortable.  The leather is very high quality, as is the whole construction.  The price is a bit daunting. However, had I initially purchased them when I first became aware of them, I would have saved a ton of money over the years.  They also have a shoe care kit that I purchased.  With proper maintenance of the leather, I can see these lasting almost indefinitely.
review.name: For me, absolutely perfect.

name: CX403 Cycling Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody:
I bought these for Touring and haven't even used them for that purpose yet; instead I was going to break in at the resort and found this was a great resort boot! Very responsive, low profile, comfortable and great heel-hold...everything I could want. As for the negative flex, the highback negates that, so I notice zero drawback there.

With the low profile of these boots and my big-ish feet, I worry less about overhang. Huge plus!

FWIW, I wear a 10 or 10.5 in street shoes, and the 10 fits me great...snug with big toe just barely kissing the end of the boot.
review.name: Love it!

name: Tourist Snowboard Boot - 2025

review.reviewBody:
I agonized over the tradeoff between the length and the portability and finally decided to get the compact. So far, I haven't been let down on two trips.

Even though the compact model is only 8 feet long, I've been able to get to all the first bolts I've needed to (so far) and have been able to clip through hard sections of two routes (OMG, I've become THAT person...) But at least it let me get to the top so I could retrieve my draws!

highly recommend, especially if you can hold out for a 20% off sale.
review.name: Happy with the Compact

review.reviewBody:
Easier to use then the squid or other stick clips I have used in the past. It was quick to learn the methods for clipping, unclipping, and hanging ropes. Love the extension method, which is much quicker than the twisting painter poles. Use it with wire gate carabiners

Can't recommend enough
review.name: Great Functionality

review.reviewBody: This is the first stick clip I have owned. I have used a number of scratch built one and a Squid before and I must say I really prefer this. The other reviewer mentioned its flimsy at full extension and that is certainly true, though in most situations I don't have to put it to full extension so it hasn't been a major issue for me. Unlike the previous reviewer I have not had an issue using the gate opening feature and a friend who also owns this has had no trouble. My go to quickdraw is the Positron by Black Diamond, so same carabiner on the bolt side. Doing any of the extra actions (rope to an existing draw, removing a draw, etc) all take practice. The only things that is really straight forward is clipping in a draw. I took mine to my local gym and they let me play around with it there. After a few tries of each I got it down. Overall I am really happy with it!
review.name: Gets the job done so you stay safe

name: Beta Stick Evo

review.reviewBody: Got these after scraping my hands up cracking climbing a couple times, and glad I did. They provide protection for the tops of your hands, while leaving the fingers free, but I do wish there was more padding like in some other crack climbing gloves (this could be personal preference, as I'm a novice climber). I'm an XS in most gloves and tried both the S and XS - was a little bit inbetween sizes with these gloves but kept the XS, so be sure to measure carefully. Overall, would recommend, as Backcountry has the best price I've seen around as well.
review.name: Great protection for crack climbing

review.reviewBody: Gloves have been great. could had some more protection for the thumb but other than that they are great.
review.name: Great gloves

review.reviewBody: These gloves provide comfortable protection without adding too much friction. They aren't super grippy, but definitely an improvement over bare hands. I've worn them just under 10 times for multiple hours and they do stretch a slight bit, so definitely don't size up. Would get five stars if they were a little stickier.
review.name: Good Protection Without Bulk

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These gloves are awesome. They are soft and flexible yet stay put and stick to rock pretty well. Only thing is the sizing. I wish they had normal sizes. I got the XS, which doesn't quite cover the pinky side of my hand (not wide enough) but the S/M was too big and moved around a lot. If they just had a size Small, it would probably be perfect.
review.name: Soft and sticky!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Thinner than some others, so depending on what you are climbing this could go either way. Construction is solid, but I expect the durability will not be as good as some thicker gloves. They do pad well for the thickness of the material. Overall, these are a very good option for a thin crack glove.
review.name: Great thin crack gloves.

review.reviewBody: I'm stoked with the new design of these gloves! The pinkie and thumb are reinforced but they've kept the same low profile. I also have tiny hands and they fit perfectly. Best crack gloves on the market!
review.name: New and improved

review.reviewBody: I'm stoked with the new design of these gloves! The pinkie and thumb are reinforced but they've kept the same low profile. Best crack gloves on the market
review.name: Improved

review.reviewBody: At first it took a bit for me to spend so much when tape is so cheap but with my local gym getting cracks i found myself spending way too much time taping up. These gloves are amazing and when they wear out i will be replacing them with the same exact thing. They cover the back of my hands way better then tape while not feeling much thicker. The best part for me is the fact that instead of having to take 8 minutes taping my hands up i can just throw these on and get right into my climb.
review.name: Money well spent

review.reviewBody: A bit loose, but not to the point that it's a problem. The finger loops seem a bit fragile, but they haven't broken yet, probably helps that they feel a bit loose. Pretty durable, used them on some really rough rock without much damage.
review.name: Really good, but not great

review.itemreviewed: Aequilibrium Speed GTX Mountaineering Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I have used la sportiva Nepals and Scarpa Mont Blancs. These are fantastic compared to the weight of those two. They fit my foot smooth, and my strides feel comfortable. The waterproofing seems stellar.

I am planning on taking these out on some bigger objectives and can update at a later date. If no news - you can assume they were fantastic.

I typically wear a size 13 shoe and a 47 mountaineering boot. I wear one layer of wool socks on alpine objectives. I rarely wear a thick mountaineering sock unless temperatures will be sub freezing during daylight. I've tried 46s and my toes immediately smash the front when I try kickstepping. Hope this helps!
review.name: Great First Impression

name: Aequilibrium Speed GTX Mountaineering Boot - Men's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Therm-ic Refresher Boot Heater online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Fantastic dryer for boot liners!  Don’t know if the UV light is marketing, but I have zero boot funk with over 80 days of riding with this.  Note, I typically remove my liners even with this so that they fully dry out after a day on the slopes

Background:  picked this up as an upgrade to Dry Guy portable heater (no fan, only heating element) inserts that I’ve used the past 5 years.  I liked the idea of airflow with low heat in order to not degrade the liner life.  I have used this all over the Western US when driving to resorts or just riding my local mountains.  I still use the dry guy if I’m flying, and my g/f or crew benefit from that on other trips.

Pros
 + low heat as to not damage liners, personal preference but key point for me
 + has a shutoff timer (I use this religiously)
 + Good airflow 
 + Relatively low profile, easy to stash in the car bag with extra clothes
 + no boot funk 😎
Cons
 - Standard plug only, not for cars.  Perhaps I misread the original description but this was a surprise.
 - Unclear airline suitability - would not check this if flying.  Given there is a fan, I would only consider bringing this if it was in my carry-on.  And while the size isn’t prohibitive, I typically just throw my dry guy elements in a boot due to their smaller size and no moving parts. 
Neutral
 - slight fan noise, but I fully expected this given I bought this to generate airflow

Backcountry support: 5/5 AWESOME.  The first item showed up with a rattle/whirring from something being loose in the assembly - more than the fan noise.  They setup an exchange and it’s been great since, ~80+ drying cycles. 

Hope this helps.  I would buy this again and absolutely recommend backcountry due their CS

review.reviewBody:
If it weren't for the short sleeves and back, I would rate this jacket 5 stars because of its wonderful features and high quality materials and workmanship.
I purchased size Large as usual and overall the jacket fits fine. Unfortunately, the sleeves are WAY TOO SHORT, particularly for a cycling jacket, you definitely want long enough sleeves because your arms are pretty much stretched out all the time. The pictures shows the sleeve length is 4 inches shorter than the GORE WEAR Men's Standard Endure Jacket (both size Large). Also, the back of the jacket is too short and about an inch shorter than the Gore Wear jacket.
If Endura would fix the sleeve length and extend the back of the jacket, this jacket would be stellar in terms of fit, features, quality and price.
review.name: Sleeves WAY TOO SHORT, and back short

description: Buy the Black Diamond HotWire Quickdraw online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: HotWire Quickdraw
hasVariant.description: Buy the Black Diamond HotWire Quickdraw online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I really like this QuickDraws, the handling and durability is perfect, not mentioning the really nice anodized colors!
review.name: I've been using the hotwire for years!

review.reviewBody: very good well made product. I work as a zodiac driver in polar regions - this quickdraw is great for cliping to other boats.
Black Diamond is always on the cutting edge of function in my opinion. The hot wire gate is easy to clip and secure for quick use.

I use these as my main draws for sport climbing. I prefer wiregates, as I mainly climb slab or vertical. The Hotwires are light, durable, and have a confident clipping feel. The keeper has just the right amount of stiffness (if you know, you know). Gate action is still smooth and snappy, even after a season of use. As a matter of personal preference, I like the Hotwire's in-hand "grip" feel better than almost any other quickdraw I've used (incl. Djinns, Photons, etc.), save for the Petzl Spirit, which are significantly more expensive. When climbing with both, I found there were times I still preferred the Hotwire. As for durability, my set looks close to new, after over a year of climbing and traveling, and despite catching a share of lead falls. The adonization on several shows minor signs of wear where the rope runs, but that is expected. Overall, at this performance/price point, you're hard pressed to beat this draw!
review.name: My favorite quickdraw for sport climbing

review.reviewBody:
Overall super good draw. It’s light enough that you could use it for Chad but I mostly used it for sport climbing. I bought these to add onto my rack and have some longer drawers and have loved them so far. I really like the size and they work super well. This is definitely geared for more of a intermediate climber. I would definitely
 buy these draws again. I think you should buy these too.
review.name: Sweet draws

review.reviewBody: Lightweight, durable and easy to use. I’ve been using these quickdraws to sport climb and set up top ropes (always opposing and opposed) for over five year. They still look great, no burrs, fraying or any issues with the gates. I went with the wire gates because it reduces the chance of gate flutter when they get jostled around. Overall a great choice in sport climbing protection.
review.name: Been using then for five + years now

review.reviewBody: Love the weight and durability. The wires on the gate are sturdy and make clipping much easier. While I would prefer to have a hybrid system, if you are looking to save weight and still have great durability, these are perfect.
Wire gates on both sides make for quick and easy clipping both onto the bolt and rope.

Well, I’ve used these on quite a few sport climbs now and I’m loving them. The gates are at the perfect tension to easily snap the rope through and I like how they are a little longer, it has caused a little less rope drag. Thanks BD!
Solid build, easy handling. After a handful of pitches, the carabineers are a bit scratched up from the walls but nothing significant. Good bang for your buck
review.name: You get what you expect

name: HotWire Quickdraw

review.reviewBody: Thankfully I was able to find this jacket on a huge discount in my size. Which is my first point which I've often mentioned in my reviews.  Ortovox size chart is often way off.  I'm 6'1" and 172lbs, athletic build and the large fits me perfectly.  If I had gone by the Ortovox size chart; (they recommended a medium)  and it wouldn't have fit. This jacket has so many features it's hard to say what I love the most.  First all the pockets.  There are so many pockets including some that a merino lined to protect your phone or water filter.  The jacket is fully lined with 100% merino wool but that said it's a pretty thin layer.  You'll still need various base layers depending on the conditions. I love the removable powder skirt and the dual adjustable hood.  Works great with my MSA Xr2 technical rescue helmet. The jacket has Pitt zips and pretty much is fully loaded and from what I can tell and others have told me it's bomb proof. The craftsmanship is just unbelievable!  My only gripe with Ortovox gear is their outrageous prices but if you're patient you can find this jacket at at least 60% off. The jacket is perfect for any skiing, free riding, long distance winter hiking etc. It's water and windproof. I wrote " runs small" but it really will depend on your body shape, for example I have long arms and torso.  I have worn Ortovox gear for years and sometimes a medium will fit, other times I need a large.  Just be prepared to possibly need to exchange for a different size.
review.name: Best of the Best but Pricey even on sale

name: Guardian Shell 3L Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody: I now have 6 of these which I purchased over the years, love the fabric quality and feel, and they are tough - the oldest ones (my very favourites!) are the ones with a higher neck and raglan type sleeves. Too bad you changed the cut/design,  but I wear all of them for hiking and every day, including occasionally with a jacket for more dressy occasions.
review.name: Fantastic top - I have one (or more?) of all colours of Mighty Stripe Long Sleeve

review.reviewBody: I bought 4, so far, now ordering 2 more. They wash up great, very durable! I love wearing mighty stripe!!
review.name: Comfort, cooling/warming in varying temperatures! Washes and dries in a jiffy

review.reviewBody: Lightweight, easy to pack, great for travel, just the right top to keep chill off without being too warm, fits well under other layers. Easy to wash, dries quickly.

review.reviewBody: Perfect shirt for being outdoors in the heat.  Love the shadow stripe effect.  Very comfortable in hot, humid weather.

review.reviewBody: I have these Mighty Stripe long sleeve tops in just about every color because the fit is so flattering and the material is light (it’s not see through) and breathable. Great for working out, hiking, housework, or simply hanging out. Also great layering under flannel shirt in the fall. You will love it!

review.reviewBody: I have two of these tops and I love them. The fit is flattering, they are comfortable, and they wash well and dry quickly. The fabric has just the right amount of stretch. They also run true to size. I am 5’ 4.5”, 100 lbs, and XS fits perfectly.

review.reviewBody: Best Color of mighty stripe shirt yet! I wear these shirts year round, and I’m so glad to add this color.

review.reviewBody: I've had these shorts in the past and also recently purchased the Bella Prima shorts which I'm very happy with.  But these shorts seem to have an odd crease in the chamois that makes it ride in the crack of your bum - not very comfortable!  Otherwise the chamois is fine as far as density and comfort on the bike but as soon as your butt is out of the saddle or you're off the bike you feel this.  Had to return and sticking with Bella Prima.  For those who say it runs small, keep in mind these are more of a compression short so they will feel tight; if you don't like that feeling you might want to size up (likewise with Bella Prima).
review.name: Chamois is odd

hasVariant.name: Vardag Crossbody Bag
hasVariant.description: Buy the Fjallraven Vardag Crossbody Bag online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Love the size and feel of the bag. However, as a dog mom, it’s not very pet hair friendly! In fact, in seems to attract all hair and loose fabric. Just have your lint roller handy.
review.name: Dog Hair Magnet

review.reviewBody: Love this. Bought it in "Basalt" along with the Vardag Pocket in "Basalt" (to use as a wallet). It's been the perfect international travel duo. Used them both on a recent trip to Sarajevo. The Crossbody was excellent in crowds or situations where there might be thieves. It holds just enough to include the basics plus a light jacket for the day. I could sling it to the front and keep a hand on the handles if in a crowd, or flip it around to the back when hiking or in a more secure area. It's rugged and didn't stand out excessively. It was great in a rain storm! The Vardag Pocket held money, passport, credit cards and phone and could be taken out of the Crossbody and hidden under my clothes for extra security, when needed.
review.name: Great Size for International Travel

review.reviewBody: I bought two of these bags in the black and the purple. They are my new favourite bags. So lightweight but easy to carry and fits a lot of stuff besides just the essentials. You can carry your iPad, water bottle and knitting , if you like. I may end up buying the green one as well as I have another Fjallraven bag in that colour and love the colour.
review.name: Fantastic. Stylish and lightweight.

review.reviewBody: This bag is great for holding all the essentials for myself and my toddler. It holds plenty, and I love that it has a carry handle as well as a crossbody strap. There are two zippered compartments, one on the inside and one on the outside in the back. There’s plenty of room and you never feel like you’re trying to find something in a black hole. Everything is accessible. Would definitely recommend for casual outings or errands.
review.name: Great mom bag!

review.reviewBody: Bought my vardag bag in march of 2022 so just over 1 year from writing this review (may 2023) . size is perfect and it's waterproof and it's a messenger bag as well as a grab bag . I can fit loads in it inc iPad mini and it also has a iPhone pocket on the outside of the bag which makes things so easy to get quick access to your mobile phone. inside pockets as well and I've added a metal clip loop for quick access for my keys . I can fit a good size purse inside it as well and my coin purse , umbrella , gloves . price is very reasonable as well . I have the storm colour and my bag still looks as good as new . cannot fault this bag at all . I use my bag all year round not just the warmer months , it's a perfect all year round bag .
review.name: Had my Bag for just over 1 year and its a great bag , highly recommend.

review.reviewBody: Love this bag. I already have a black one and bought another in the blue. Lightweight and slim in design yet it holds a lot. I carry a wallet, cosmetic case, card case, glasses case, two Ka ken keychains, a small planner and tissues. Yet it still doesn’t feel heavy. Love the short grab handles and the adjustable king strap.
review.name: Perfect bag for the spring and summer

review.reviewBody:
I purchased this bag to use as my "personal item" for an international flight and sight-seeing at the destination. Since my main luggage for the trip was a backpack, I wanted a bag that was versatile and could be easily carried/held by shoulder or by hand. The short handles worked very well as I traversed the airport, and the main compartment was big enough to hold two Kindles, a water bottle, and other stuff I needed to access during the flights. The shoulder handle is only aspect of the bag where I had an issue: the material is very rough and chafed my skin when it slid off my shirt onto my neck/shoulder. Otherwise, the bag performed very well when I carried it on sight-seeing jaunts. I accidently rubbed the bag up against a stone wall one day, and the material held up very well.
The bag could be improved by adding a shoulder protector/pad to the handle to prevent irritation.
review.name: Good Functionality

review.reviewBody: I bought this to keep my knitting in and misc stuff.  I love it!  I was looking for a low, cube-like tote and I found it here!  When I need it to stand upright-ish, I slouch it down.  I wish I could attach my photos of it!
review.name: Love!

review.reviewBody: had this bag for 7 months now and its amazing! love it for day to day erands as well as for work, it can fit more than it seems! really a great bag
review.name: love it!!

review.reviewBody: I bought this in the blue color storm. The color is gorgeous and the bag is very comfortable to wear. The adjustable strap is not very thick but I haven’t found that to be a problem even when I have it packed full. I can fit a lot in the main section of the purse, a chunky wallet, two hard glasses cases, a small makeup pouch, and the smaller size gear bag which I have quite a lot of things in. I could fit two in but I haven’t had the need to yet. I keep my phone and a pouch of tissues in the back zipped compartment. This is perfect for me, a person who tries to only carry the necessities but manages to bring way more than necessary!
review.name: Lightweight and beautiful

name: Vardag Crossbody Bag

review.reviewBody: I’m an athletic-curvy gal and ordered a medium. The look is fantastic. They hug in the bum area and are slightly loose in the thigh. They are a slight squeeze to get over the bum, but once they’re up they have some give and wiggle room. There is no stretch in the shorts at all (except for the waist which has slight stretch to it). Prana definitely stuck with the vintage stiff feel to go along with the vintage style. I really like them but they would be 5 stars if they had some stretch to the fabric.
review.name: Great but could be fantastic

review.reviewBody: I ordered these shorts for a vacation, but they arrived late, and because I was paying full price and not able to enjoy them on my trip, I returned them unopened.  So, I am not able to offer an opinion of the product, just the fact that BackCountry uncharacteristically let me down with shipping on a full price item.
review.name: Item returned because order arrived late

review.reviewBody:
These shorts remind me of the ones I wore as a kid in the 90s and I love the mix of patterns. They are comfortable and light. I would recommend!

Two things to note: (1) the cinching strap is offset and hangs down a few inches when I tighten them so it's always visible, and (2) the shorts seem to run a bit big, but I think that's just the fit. For reference I am 5' 10", 175 lbs and wear a size medium (mens). The medium shorts are loose fitting but I can easily tighten them in the waist to get the right fit.

Overall really like these shorts from Prana!
review.name: Great Shorts, love the style!

review.reviewBody:
i was looking for an all around short to wear climbing, kayaking or just to work and i was stoked to find these. i got the dark sky pattern and it's such a cool throwback piece! from prana's website, i've seen some reviews about the fit being boxier and heavily leaning towards the men's sizing/fit and that it looks like the shorts have been altered for the woman model; i have some answers here!!
i got a small and a medium because i was in between sizes; the key factor here (which they don't share on any of the size charts) is that the small is a 4" inseam and the medium (and i assume above) is a 5" inseam. 
for reference, i'm 5'1" and about 155 pounds and am usually a size medium bottom; i ultimately decided on the small because i liked the fit better and it was more flattering. the medium, was in fact, more boxier. hope this helps!!
review.name: LOVE THESE

name: Indio Heritage Short

review.reviewBody:
Like everything bluewater makes, this product does the job, but finds a way to Inconvenience the user unnecessarily.  The webbing itself is fine, maybe even above average. The issue is that the webbing comes rolled and is held together with extremely poor quality tape that is difficult to remove in one piece and leaves a really nasty/sticky residue on each end of the webbing (this affects about a foot on one end and a few inches on the other). The adhesive can come off in chunks in your hand and the webbing will remain very sticky (making it difficult to knot, etc). Warm water and mild soap got most of it off with some work.

I'll give bluewater the benefit of the doubt and say that heat/ humidity probably compromised the adhesive in transit (I can't imagine they would knowingly ship a product like that), but there are much better ways to package webbing regardless. Also, why isn't it hot cut????
review.name: Good product. Awful packaging.

name: Tubular Climb-Spec 1in Webbing Disk

description: Buy the Grundens Deviation 6in Ankle Boot - Men's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Deviation 6in Ankle Boot - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Grundens Deviation 6in Ankle Boot - Men's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Just what you need when you need it. Great grip, and good pretty darn cool as well.
review.name: Don’t leave home without em

review.reviewBody: I have been wearing these for a long time. My 3rd pair. Comfortable, easy to wear, love them
review.name: great boots

review.reviewBody: I have been using the original Xtra Tough Boots for over 15 years and they are still working well.  Those boots were durable, didn't have the best cushion, but I just got used to them over the years. I decided to buy these Deviation Ankle Boots to see if they were any different, and yes, they are A LOT more comfortable!  More cushion and comfort compared to the old kids rain boot feel of the Xtra tough boots.
review.name: Deviation Ankle Boots are very comfortable

review.reviewBody: Great boot- initially a little tight fit but broke in very nicely. Durable.
review.name: Overall Great Boot!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great boots, super versatile! Would recommend to anyone.
review.name: Great boots, super versatile!

review.reviewBody: Wear these boots every single day for work, after a year and a couple of insole swaps they still have good tread and no leaks. They are a bit heavier and quite hot during summer months but it it by far superior to every other boot of this style when it comes to durability
review.name: Holds up well

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Fishing for a living and being on my feet all day I require a rubber boot that provides comfort all day. These are for the win. The ankle high helps stay cool in the summer.
review.name: Great Boot

review.reviewBody: I purchased these boots three years ago and had concerns about the stitching from the start (see one of my earlier reviews). As shown in the pictures, my suspicions were correct. The boots are tough and durable, and I still use them and recommend them, but the stitching has failed, leading to deterioration on the top. Despite this, I’ve recommended them to friends and even bought additional pairs for family members and myself. However, be aware that the stitching may not hold up over time.
review.name: Follow up on my purchase 3 years ago

review.reviewBody: Awesome boot I wear these all hunting season until it gets really cold and even then I wear them from where ever until I put on other boots. I wear them fishing all the time. I wear them going out and doing just land management. Had one pair for two years now and finally showing some wear on the inside and out never have had a boot or shoe last me as long as these did
review.name: Great boot

review.reviewBody: Was in the local Chandler looking for shore boots. Never were my full boots. While trying all the brands these seemed just built better. I’m using these for sailing and theses seemed overkill. Then I walked around and forgot these were boots. I walked in in very comfortable sailing runners and these “fishing boots” felt better on my feet. I’m a disabled veteran and walk with a Cain an heavily rely on proper footwear for each situation. These boots are nice wow. I obviously liked them as I paid for them. Sailing another 500miles till home. Will report back with time in the swell on the lean.
review.name: Wow

name: Deviation 6in Ankle Boot - Men's

description: Buy the Schwalbe Nobby Nic Addix Evolution 29in Tire online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Nobby Nic Addix Evolution 29in Tire
hasVariant.description: Buy the Schwalbe Nobby Nic Addix Evolution 29in Tire online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: This tire is offered in a wide array of casing compounds from lightweight xc oriented casing to a DH ready casing. The tire was redesigned to allow better mud clearance and also for more grip for braking and cornering. I have been quite impressed with how well it hooks up in the corners and how much traction it offers up while braking. One big thing in the past with Schwable has been their tires life spans being quite short. With the newer tires I am finding them to hold up much better even in the soft compound. I haven't had any issues with flats with this tire either here in Utah. Overall been very happy with how much confidence this tire provides on the corners and when braking down steep sections.
review.name: Great All Rounder

name: Nobby Nic Addix Evolution 29in Tire

review.reviewBody: Born date was only a few months before opening and there was already an inch thick plug in the unopened and sealed bottle.  Product also froze solid while sitting next to a bottle of Stans sealant that was still liquid.  Never even got a chance to put it in my tires to try it out.  Contacted Orange Seal but they made excuses and quit responding.  Inferior durability and longevity based on my experience thus far.
review.name: solidified in new bottle

review.reviewBody: I?ve seen other sealants after months in a tire and it just leaves a layer of mess and boogers in the tires. Orange sealant does a great job of staying liquid and cleans up really well.  Now that would make you wonder about its sealing abilities but so far it hasn?t let me down.
review.name: Orange Sealant is fantastic
