review.itemreviewed: Bulo Point II Down Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This jacket is super comfortable and warm. I love the length—it is stylish! It is a little bigger, so it gives room for some layers underneath if needed.
review.name: Cute and Warm

review.itemreviewed: Bulo Point II Down Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: I genuinely love this jacket! So comfy, warm and chic; fits well with my style. Great quality, too! I'm 162cm tall, 50 kg, wearing size M. small size fits me too but i like to wear have many layers when the weather gets chilly
review.name: BEST BUY

review.itemreviewed: Bulo Point II Down Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] It’s comfortable and warm. It doesn’t make me looking fat. Love it.
review.name: Shiny and cozy jacket

review.itemreviewed: Bulo Point II Down Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great warm jacket. Also love the velvet look, very sleek and edgy.
review.name: Great buy

review.itemreviewed: Bulo Point II Down Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very warm! It is a bit more cropped but hits right below the waist. Overall great jacket! I got my normal size and it was roomy enough to wear a sweatshirt underneath
review.name: Love it

review.itemreviewed: Bulo Point II Down Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love the look of this jacket! It was exactly what I was looking for. Looks nicer than a traditional coat and versatile for any occasion while keeping me warm!
review.name: In love with this jacket

review.itemreviewed: Bulo Point II Down Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I am super picky and I got my inspiration off of my sons friend’s Columbia coat and I loved it but wanted something super warm when I have to walk to the end of the block in the winter to the bus as my son is in a wheelchair. I went to many brick and mortars and still didn’t find all of the qualities I was looking for. I wanted warm puffy and velvety and I came across this sale and was ecstatic when I saw exactly what I was looking for! I since have ordered a coat hat and mittens for my kiddo and as much as I hate the cold in Kansas City I can’t wait to show off my guy in his cute warm quality gear!
review.name: Over The Moon!!

review.itemreviewed: Bulo Point II Down Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Jacket was just what I expected to be supper warm.
review.name: Amazing jacket

review.itemreviewed: Bulo Point II Down Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Jacket runs true to size/slightly big. It’s definitely roomy and has enough room for layers. If you don’t plan to layer while wearing this jacket you may want to size down. The jacket is fairly boxy but the waist cinchers really helped to make the shape a little more feminine. I’ve gotten several compliments because the black has a sheen that makes it look velvety but it’s smooth. Very unique. And oh is WARM duh. Would purchase again.
review.name: Warm jacket for NYC winters

review.itemreviewed: Bulo Point II Down Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great jacket. Runs true to size while still have room to fit layers under it. I love it.
review.name: great buy

name: Bulo Point II Down Jacket - Women's

review.reviewBody: We have been using Camelbak MULE hydration packs for many years, for both day hikes and on long unsupported bike rides.  The new MULE has great storage capacity and many great features, but may not be as adaptable for biking (especially if a tandem stoker wears one) as past versions.  Given that, it is a great hydration pack for day hikes.

review.reviewBody: I love the Coefficient Quarter Zip. Great for cool weather with a t-shirt, and also as a layer.
review.name: Awesome

review.reviewBody: A must have sweater! For run, for trad and ice climbing. Best all around sweater in years. I fit better in the xs man ( I’m a lady wearing XS women. ) Shoulders a bot larger and it stays fit at the bottom.
review.name: Buy before their sold out!

review.reviewBody:
Breathable, stretchable, and warm... this hoodie is perfect for hiking during the shoulder seasons in Virginia. 
Fit: The medium size has no extra room and I am 5'8" and 143 lbs.
review.name: Awesome hoody!

review.reviewBody: I have a lean muscular build and am 6'1" 160 lbs. This fits me perfectly and is very cozy/warm while still being breathable and light.
review.name: Amazing fit

review.reviewBody: I own several mid layers of this realm from many diff companies. The Coefficient ranks up there with the best in looks and function. The Co was my first Black Diamond purchase. I'll be sure to buy more gear
review.name: Coefficient 1/4 Zip

review.reviewBody: I have a full zip version of the same item and it is my go to for backpacking and skiing. The hood is great under a ski helmet. This one will be used for running too. My favorite Black Diamond product.
review.name: Love the fit

review.reviewBody:
The old standard here was called the R1, from another brand. I've been looking at all the fleeces lately since I'm at the stage where I've trashed a lot of my gear and starting to replace it. The BD coefficient has what others done, great fit, good hood, an actual zipper guard (unlike the r1). It's fantastic.

2 gripes: if my zipper goes down all the way it sticks, I'll probably contact warranty since it has done this since I got it new, and I think the material could be thicker given the price.

Overall, there's nothing better that I tried...and I tried a lot of them. Enjoy! 6ft2in, 205lb broad shoulders, xl is perfect.
review.name: Great fleece for climbing

review.reviewBody: I bought this as a mid layer. It fits great and snug, not too snug over my first layer. Lots of stretch and the hood fits great under a helmet. Also like how it zips up high and creates a mini face shield. For reference I'm 6' and 150 lbs, I bought the medium. Much recommended!
review.name: Great Fit!

review.reviewBody: I have the coefficient lt hoodie, which is my favorite, and I wanted a backup. This is heavier and feels more durable. The slim fit is why I like it so much. I’m 6’2” buck 70 picked up a size Large. This has great arm length and not boxy at all. Will last forever I’m sure.
review.name: Great addition!

review.reviewBody:
A great piece of kit to bolster up as a layer on a cold day and wear as an outer on a chilly morning. 

As valuable on a belay as it is around the campfire. 

A bit snug around the armpits, but that is typical for my body in BD clothing.
review.name: Multifunctional and quality

name: Coefficient 1/4-Zip Fleece Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody:
The box was broken,  and obviously someone used it. Terrible experience. 
It's disgusting.
review.name: I received someone's return

review.reviewBody:
I have been riding mountain bikes for some time know and have tried knee pads from all the major brands like Troy Lee, Fox and G-Form. Nothing protects like these pads - NOTHING! 

I ride high speed enduro trails in So Cal, Utah and AZ full of rocks and nastiness and I have had my share of heavy slams. Every other pad provided some protection but not without bruising. These pad provide extreme protection and are very comfortable to ride with all day. 

If you are only riding mellow cross country these may be a little over kill.
review.name: FIVE Star Performance

hasVariant.description: Buy the PEARL iZUMi Attack Short - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Pearl Izumi as a brand makes excellent riding shorts. Everytime I try a different brand, they just don't fit right or feel as well made. Out of all the ones I've tried, these fit and feel the best. I honestly have and will continue to recommend these to anyone looking for a good comfortable pair, that fit right, and offer the padding needed.
review.name: The most comfortable pair I own

review.reviewBody: I bought Attack shorts in 2019.  Great product - 6 panel shorts and very comfortable.  I wanted another pair.  Unfortunately the 2021 Attack shorts are 4 panel and of lower quality and comfort.  they changed the seat pad also.  Might as well purchase the Quest Shorts.  I am returning this product.
review.name: Pearl Izumi - Down graded product

review.reviewBody: These are very disappointing, especially from a company like Pearl Izumi.  The seams for the padding are rough, and the padding is poor - feels like foam rubber.   These are very different than the more expensive shorts they sell, and I see why.  Uncomfortable shorts are not worth anything, since you wouldn't want to wear them at all.
review.name: Pearl Izumi Attack Short

review.reviewBody: Pearl Izumi should be ashamed to sell these shorts at this price.  They are much inferior to the previous style of Attack shorts.  These 4-panel shorts are way less comfortable - no matter what the material.  They just don't fit well.  The pad is not comfortable at all.  The leg openings also are not comfortable.  I wish I could return them.  A very poor product from Pearl Izumi.  Don't buy these shorts!!!
review.name: Very disappointed

review.reviewBody: got these a couple weeks ago and have put about 250 miles on them. great fit and comfort. 130 of these miles were on the salt to saint relay where 4 of us rode 427 miles. did not get any hot spots and even on my last mile they still provided good comfort. will buy again!!
review.name: great shorts!!

review.reviewBody: PI must be cutting costs as this is the same lining/chamois as the cheaper models. No 3D padding - will be returning ASAP.
review.name: cheap material, sold at higher price

name: Attack Short - Men's

review.reviewBody: The strap system and pack are great. We just tried it out on a four-day river trip before heading to the Boundary Wates for over a week. The only negative was getting so hot because of it being black. Temperatures on our trip were over 100 and we had to splash water on the pack before touching.
review.name: Great pack, hot in the sun.

review.reviewBody:
The harness is he closes dry bag to a backpack.. Usable for hiking. Roll op closure is good but not submerge waterproof.
The bottom on my pack started separating front the rest of the pack after 3 years, but was replaced under warranty. Yea! Customer service!
review.name: Great harness, comfortable,

review.reviewBody:
I ordered the 65l and 115l Black Canyon bags for packrafting. The bags look really good, comfortable to carry and well designed. Many things are adjustable to content and body.
But as I took a closer look on the bag, I saw that the coating was scratched at two places so the white lining gets visible. And at a even closer look, there were some more spots where the coating isn't good – all of those spots are where the bag was folded. As you have to fold it for closing and crinkling is quiet normal in use, I guess the bag could loose its waterproofness quickly. If it gets damaged by shipping I ask myself how it gets around with rough conditions
review.name: Coating ragged even at delivery

review.reviewBody: I use my pack every three days and it is one of the best out there! Hiking down the steep trail with a loaded pack isn't easy. But with this pack, it makes it more enjoyable. The padded back helps when you accidentally put something sharp in the wrong place and the support helps when carrying large amounts of beer. I love how they integrated a frame pack style system into a dry bag. It makes my life way easier hiking to my boat every three days! Tons of room and super durable as well. I have put this pack to the test only owning it for a couple weeks. It has held up through thick and thin thus far. It's named the black canyon for a reason...
review.name: Perfect for the die hard hike in boater!

review.reviewBody: Wish it fit a smaller person better, but overall great quality and worked well for packrafting
review.name: Good for packrafting

review.reviewBody: Quality bag. Well made to Cary lots of stuff and keep it dry. The light colored inside material makes it easier to find things in the bag. Yellow exterior makes bag easy to find in the river if you capsize.
review.name: Excellent Dry Bag

review.reviewBody: All of our seal line dry bags have been amazing and stood up well in extremely rugged conditions. When we had one strap come undone on a relatively new bag the company was wonderful with their support - providing advice on how to repair and then promptly following up with warranty. I think they are able to do this because the products are so well made that we personally haven't ever had to consider a repair until now. Thank you! and thank you for moving towards PVC free products as well.
review.name: Well made products, amazing customer service and warranty

review.reviewBody: I own a couple of these bags along with the Pro Dry Pack. I use them on all my outdoor whitewater trips and I am not nice to them. I have literally hiked with them through fire burns, dropped them down the sides of mountains, and sent them swimming down rapids. Every time, my stuff is secure, dry, and better off for being in this bags. The durability of these SealLines is unmatched by anything I have used and they are comfortable to wear for any portage. If you need something to keep your gear dry and accessible, pick one up.
review.name: Great bags that keep your stuff dry when you aren't

review.reviewBody: The packs work great on the trampoline of our catamaran for any excursion requiring that we keep out kit dry. They are no-brainers in the canoes,
review.name: We will always have these in our inventory

review.reviewBody: I took this bag on a 24 day trip down the grand canyon. This bag got tossed around, laid in the sand, loaded and unloaded every single day and held up great. Everything on the inside was always dry for me. That includes a submersion after I flipped my raft that kept it completely underwater for about 45 minutes. My beef with the pack however is the straps on the outside. I really wanted to love this pack but soon become envious of my other group members that had the NRS Bills bag. First of all, the shoulder strap design is sort of obnoxious. If you don't have it fully strapped down your gonna be snagging webbing every which way. Normally, not a problem but when it is open and you need to move it across camp it was a real pain. On that note, it didn't have a functional haul loop or handle like the NRS bag. Finally, they advertise removable shoulder straps. In theory, sure, you can take them off but it is a huge hassle. Not something you would want to do with any frequency. Overall, they performed great but I was pretty annoyed with everything on the outside.
review.name: Dryness - 5 stars functionality - 3 stars.

name: Black Canyon 65-115L Dry Pack

review.itemreviewed: Vioz Lux GTX RR Backpacking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I’m prepping for the High Sierra Trail and got these boots for training. They really are amazing. Comfortable right out of the box and no breaking in needed. For me, the most important thing is that they were grippy so that I’m not slipping and sliding on dirt and rock on steep inclines. These do just that — truly incredible craftsmanship. Hoping my husband invests in a pair too!
review.name: Amazing boots

review.itemreviewed: Vioz Lux GTX RR Backpacking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody:
First, these are backpacking boots and therefore “heavy.”  However, they are not horribly heavy but maybe it’s what I expected. 

Second, I have narrow heels, extremely high arches and insteps and a very wide forefoot. And short Achilles’ tendons. It is nearly impossible to find ANY shoes that are comfortable and don’t make my toes go numb and hurt and burning pain in the balls of my feet. 

I wear an 8W generally and go up to 8.5 for running and hiking and snowboarding. You get the picture. I also generally wear a 39 EU. Heeding the advice of others I went with an 8.5 US (40.5 EU). They fit perfect. I had new custom inserts made at my local running store and swapped out the insoles. I hiked 5.5 miles day one in moderately technical trails in Colorado. Next day 4.4 miles equally as challenging and wet too. No slip, all grip!  So dang comfortable. I actually thought “I wonder if people will notice if I wear these all the time! Maybe I should buy a second pair in the other color.” (I got the dark green ones and they are beautifully made!). Just can’t say enough about these!! Worth the $ to hike, backpack, snowshoe in comfort.
review.name: Best dang boot ever for my problem feet

review.itemreviewed: Vioz Lux GTX RR Backpacking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I am between a size 6.5 and 7. Typically I wear 6.5 in dress shoes and dress boots, however I wear a size 7 in Asics running shoes and a 7 in French dress shoes. After reading the reviews, I decided to go with a size 7 in these boots, which ended up being too big for my feet, even when I tried the boots on with a thicker wool sock. I am returning the 7 for a size 6.5. Hope this helps.
review.name: Great Boots - My Review on Sizing

review.itemreviewed: Vioz Lux GTX RR Backpacking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody:
According to size chart I am a 41or a size 9. After reading many reviews I ordered a 9.5. Or a 42. I have a medium width foot. The fit is perfect with ragg wool hiking socks. Firm ankle support and plenty of toe room. 
Beautiful leather and great grippy vibram soles.
review.name: Perfect fit ladies size

review.itemreviewed: Vioz Lux GTX RR Backpacking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: These are perfectly constructed gorgeous boots. Unfortunately I had to return them because they are just a little bit too heavy for me. If you're looking for a solid boot then this is the right choice for you.
review.name: Gorgeous

review.itemreviewed: Vioz Lux GTX RR Backpacking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: These boots got me through an Extreme Alaskan hike. Walked in all types of different terrain. They kept my feet dry. True to size. They are expensive boots but? What price do you put on your feet?
review.name: Alaskan Tough

name: Vioz Lux GTX RR Backpacking Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody:
Nimble and breathable jacket, perfect for all weather usage. Great for weekend warriors and multiday sky trips.  Wear it with a light sweater or as a shell. 
Bought XL or size bigger for confort and layering. 

Wore it 5 days in a row with no issues, comfortable ventilation under the arms, lightweight fabric.  

The only catch is wearing the hood with a helmet can be a bit tricky on the downhill while snowboarding due the the head turning.  Aside from that everything is great the neck length is great.
review.name: Excellent Jacket

review.reviewBody: Bought this a month ago but haven't had a chance to go skiing yet. Seems nice not too heavy and long sleeves. One thing I did notice is the dedicated phone pocket is too small for the larger modern phones (Samsung Galaxy Note20 so or similar). Thought HH should have been aware of this and made it bigger. My wife bought a Montec which has a great large phone pocket. Come one HH get your act together.
review.name: Good jacket

review.reviewBody: Best design and materials. I buy new sets about every 3 years and this evolution is excellent. Fit is true to size.
review.name: Jacket and pants

review.reviewBody:
Really wanted to keep this jacked but unfortunately I had to return it. Great materials, workmanship, and color. Great features. However, the jacket runs tight in shoulders. Tried it with baselayers and moving arms around one can definitely feel the tightness on shoulders and arm pits.  I am an average build - no huge biceps or shoulders. 
Great jacket otherwise. Would be a great fit for someone with narrower frame but fit for height. 
Too bad....
review.name: Great materials and color - runs small

review.reviewBody: Redwood melange is fire. Sizing is fine. Decent warmth without bulk.
review.name: Color is am

review.reviewBody:
Color wise the jacket is much darker in person than website pictures.

The logos of the jacket are actually bright orange and not black as pictured.

As  the other reviews mentioned this Jacket fits weird. I am 5?11? and 200 pounds. The large was too tight in my arms and shoulders. I exchanged for an extra large and was swimming and that jacket.

I really wanted to like this jacket but the fit was very strange and doesn?t work for me.
review.name: Weird sizing

review.reviewBody:
So I'm not a very thick person and my arms I'd say lean towards the smaller size. Wearing this jacket feels fine and very comfy until you have to move your arms. The shoulders are not wide enough gets kind of tight if you cross your arms. I can't even bring my elbows in to touch in front of me. Also the elbow area is very tight. The fabric will bunch up and pinch your skin pretty good. You could get away with a thin base layer but it's still going to pinch some. Forget about running a thick base layer or even a mid layer with this jacket if you don't at least go up a size that you think fits you. 

If it wasn't for the shoulders being narrow and the elbow area of the sleeves being too small this jacket would honestly be perfect. The construction is nice, It's very warm and I like all the pocket placements. I especially like the hand gaiters! I could definitely deal with the shoulders being kind of narrow but the elbow pinching is just disappointing since all the other sizing portions of the jacket are good (torso, sleeve length and overall jacket length). If you have broad shoulders and thicker than average arms, this jacket is definitely not for you.
review.name: Looks nice, runs tight

review.reviewBody: This is the best ski/snowboarding jacket I've ever owned. It is super comfortable, has all the bells and whistles, and regulates temp well. The material is bomb proof and I love the color. Can't wait for a monster powder day to really put this jacket through some work!
review.name: Best Jacket I've Ever Owned

name: Garibaldi 2.0 Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody: I waited too long to buy this parka, using my Phantom jacket instead for several years. Yet the Phantom belay parka kept me so toasty camping on Mt. Rainier as well as belaying in 40+ mph wind gusts while mixed climbing. I love that it goes over my harness easily, and the second zip makes it so my booty stays warm and covered while I still have access to my belay loop. The material is also really hardy—I scraped it against some rough granite walls while climbing up a chimney, and no holes or anything. I usually wear a small but bought medium so I can fit it over a fully loaded harness and other layers.
review.name: Don’t wait to buy this parka

review.reviewBody: This is a well-made bag, but know that it is very structured and stiff. You may love that design, but for my husband, it’s uncomfortable to wear and difficult to squish under an airplane seat.

review.reviewBody: Had my Thule Crossover 2 for over a year now, travel on average every other week and this piece of equipment has yet to disappoint. many compliments from fellow travelers and coworkers alike.
review.name: Form, function, durability and good looks....

review.reviewBody:
Been using this bag for about four months primarily as a carryon travel bag.  Pro: Very sturdy bag with comfortable straps. Like the top protective pocket for glasses.

Cons:  The water bottle zipper is SO disappointing, does not keep in place.  Compartments are not user friendly.

Would gladly send back.
review.name: Disappointed

review.reviewBody: Backpack is great! I bought for an upcoming trip to have a sturdy option to travel carry-on, and it performs great! I haven't had any issues fitting stuff into it, or accessing anything in my bag (I was a little worried with some previous reviews) but it works great! I may just buy a second one so I don't have to swap out work and play all the time!
review.name: Love it!

review.reviewBody:
I've been used the Thule Crossover 2 20L for 3 years. And I haven't had any problems. Well, yes, with the front, those parts are like rubber...I think that is great product. The costumer service is fantastic, because they replacement the Crossover for the problem with rubber. 

I have a question. The Thule has a compartment for laptop. But in which of the two compartments in the back put my laptop? I didn't  mention the central part...
review.name: Great product!

review.reviewBody: I love the look, construction and quality but the design of the three sections is very poor. You have to go digging for items in the dark since the zipper is not lower enough to allow the sections to open wider to be able to see inside. Needs better compartments to organize computer accessories like mouse, power bucks and cables. Did not realize these flaws until I used it an after the 30 days or would have returned.
review.name: Section don’t open wide enough
comment:
Thank you for your input on the Thule Crossover 2 backpack. 
The Thule Crossover 2 is designed to meet the needs of most commuters through accessibility and organization features. The front pocket of the bag has a series of sections designed for stowing chargers, cables, and other small accessories so they are always easy to find. While the bag does not open all the way to the bottom, it does allow for some of the most access out of any of Thule's laptop backpacks. The Thule Crossover 2 is designed to stand upright for easy loading, so some lateral support is necessary to ensure it stands easily. 
I'm sorry to hear this bag did not meet your needs. If opening fully in a "clamshell" design is a priority for your bags, I recommend taking a look at the Thule Aion 28L, which opens fully to access the main storage compartment for travel packing. 
https://www.thule.com/en-us/backpacks/backpacking-travel-backpacks/thule-aion-travel-backpack-28l-_-3204721

review.reviewBody: The bag is of nice quality craftsmanship. The only drawback is the the compartments don't open fully witch makes it hard to find putting things in and out of bag. If you need a lot of space this bag dose not offer that. I would still recommend this bag because of the quality.
review.name: good quality

review.reviewBody:
I've been using this backpack for a week now and I'm quite disappointed with the organization for smaller items.

Let's start with the good.

I love the overall aesthetics and look of the bag. I love that the bag maintains it's shape and stands up on the floor. It's also made of really durable, luggage material, so there's no doubt it will have a long life of daily use.

Now for the bad...

I really hate that there is not much storage for smaller items in the front pocket. The front pocket is deceptively small and there is not much room to store anything with creating unsightly bulges on the bag that make it difficult to zip it closed. I would've much rather preferred shrinking the large compartment of the bag by a couple inches to make more space in the front of the bag for smaller items. 

The zipper pulls are all metal, and very noisy. It sounds like I'm walking around with little bells on.

I hate the water bottle pocket. My 532 ml steel water bottle from a well known brand fits too loosely and slips out if the bag is place flat on a seat or desk top. I would've much preferred the typical mesh pouch on the side like most backs use. I also dislike how it looks with the side pockets puffed out with a bottle in it, it ruins the aesthetics.

I hate that the main compartment is mostly open space - might be great for storing packing cubes of clothes or larger items like a coat, but this is a business bag, so more flexibility for storing smaller items in the front pocket would've been better. There's not even a proper spot to store my laptop mouse and power adapter!

I hate that the "paper" pocket in the main compartment of the bag is not more rigid or flat.  This leads to my loose papers or soft folders getting a bit warped in the bag - not great for business use.

I was surprised that the padding on the bottom of the laptop compartment doesn't have better coverage. There's a gap in the padding where the laptop could hit the floor directly when being put down.

Overall, I wish I could return this bag but I'm now stuck with it. Very disappointed with Thule as they were highly recommended for their excellent luggage and quality other products. The Crossover 2 backpack just misses the mark for my everyday and travel laptop backpack of choice.
review.name: Disappointing Backpack

review.reviewBody: Like expected really good quality, light for travel plenty of room inside.
review.name: Good quality

review.reviewBody: I bought a Thule Crossover in 2012 and loved it. This is the upgraded version and I am in love with it!!! Amazing product, grateful to have Thule as a household brand. We *always* buy thule.
review.name: Incredible & Stylish Bag

name: Crossover 2 30L Backpack

review.reviewBody: I love these socks. I've seen ultra runners use these and they swear by them so I fogured I would give them a try. Easy to say I am super impressed and will continue to wear / buy these socks again in the future. If you are on the fence, give them a try.
review.name: Best running socks

review.itemreviewed: Ultra Run Crew CoolMax Sock - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I used to have issues with blisters between my toes. The injinji line was a game changer for me. These socks in particular, the Ultra Run Crew CoolMax Sock, are my absolute favorites for their comfort, cushion, and their durability. 

The awesome functionality of Injinji will quickly help you get past the odd look of toe socks and the extra 10 seconds it takes to put the sock on. No more inner toe blisters + comfortable toe splay for the win!
review.name: Best socks I own
